commit_message:
Replace oslo_utils.fnmatch with fnmatch

The oslo_utils.fnmatch module was added to solve an issue in py2.7 but
it is no longer required because py2.7 is no longer supported.
The module was deprecated since oslo.utils 4.9.1[1] and the stdlib's
fnmatch module should be used instead.

[1] 4c893c92f551c9dd2a7cfbe7ae8171ad8139df0b

Change-Id: If6ea16bbad5a7454e3a0f190c5a5e8da17f01a89

commit_message:
Add a trait for the "bochs" display device

The 'bochs' display device is a recommended[1] safe option for UEFI
guests.

This lets an admin set the trait either via the flavor extra-specs or
image metadata properties:

    trait:COMPUTE_GRAPHICS_MODEL_BOCHS=required

This also allows The libvirt virt dirver report a standard trait
for bochs graphics model support and enables the image_metadata_prefilter
to automatically request the trait. This will enable vm that request
the bochs graphics model to be automaticaly scheduled to hosts that
can support it.

Implements: blueprint add-bochs-display-device
[1]: https://www.kraxel.org/blog/2019/09/display-devices-in-qemu/#tldr
Change-Id: Iba867f4632853f99373976e39c3494ea1c8b91a2
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[packaging-deb] Transition Ocata to End of Life

However packaging-deb is retired some of its repositories' stable/ocata
branches still exist. This patch tags these branches with ocata-eol to
enable us to remove the branches.

Change-Id: I3bbadae8b333c341ecdd4734ee62516c51ad9490

commit_message:
[dragonflow] Set eol to Dragonflow Ocata

Dragonflow is not listed under deliverables of ocata, however it has
stable/ocata branch open.

This patch adds dragonflow under ocata deliverables just to make it
possible to tag it with ocata-eol and delete the branch.

Change-Id: I6f81ab30fab147a85d759b4db45b6265720e6f27

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-16 18:16:08.000000000', 'message': "[powervm] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: Ifed70bcb24e6bff2be6c9a81e2bf5865694c48c0
"}]
commit_message:
[powervm] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: Ifed70bcb24e6bff2be6c9a81e2bf5865694c48c0

commit_message:
Release final glance_store for Xena

This proposed a release for glance_store to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, August 23.

Change-Id: Ib13cbe6e35c83d89216ad24958c4004affba13cb

commit_message:
Release final ironic-lib for Xena

This proposed a release for ironic-lib to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, August 23.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.7.1..44131be
12bca21 json_rpc: setup.cfg is missing entrypoint for json_rpc's list_opts
f6ddd09 json_rpc: list_opts() should return tuple
b750b74 Add lower-constraints job to current development branch
54a176a Increase version of hacking and pycodestyle
d33cf3e Use the json format output of qemu-img info
f7db05c Update min version of tox to use allowlist
e4d7c1f utils.execute: log stdout and stderr even on failure
6aa9425 Remove the logic specific to the way deployment works

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iab0e1df1d1c25227dcc427b1b98dc4b37614fa64

commit_message:
Use placement version allowing re-parenting RP update

That is microversion 1.37.

The next time a placement re-sync is triggered (for example by
restarting the respective agents) this corrects the parents
of wrongly created resource providers introduced by bug #1921150.

Change-Id: I6b54aa9c21bf28de1d451c195e37efde6110258a
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/placement/+/784020
Related-Bug: #1921150

subject: Add update-trilio action
messages: [{'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2021-08-16 13:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2021-08-17 11:24:47.000000000', 'content': 'Topic more-bundles removed'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2021-08-17 11:25:07.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to update-action'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2021-08-19 11:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-16 13:20:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add update-trilio action

Add update-trilio action which can be run after a Trilio
upgrade.

Trilio sometimes updates packages in package repositiories that
require DB migrations or config file changes. Since these package
updates are not applied by the charm as they would be by changing the
openstack-origin or triliovault-pkg-source the charm has no event to
react to to automatically perform the post package upgrade actions.
This change adds an action `update-trilio` which can
be run to apply the changes.

Change-Id: I60034c9a7b14307835776a30b753905aab87aa75
'}]
commit_message:
Add update-trilio action

Add update-trilio action which can be run after a Trilio
upgrade.

Trilio sometimes updates packages in package repositiories that
require DB migrations or config file changes. Since these package
updates are not applied by the charm as they would be by changing the
openstack-origin or triliovault-pkg-source the charm has no event to
react to to automatically perform the post package upgrade actions.
This change adds an action `update-trilio` which can
be run to apply the changes.

Change-Id: I60034c9a7b14307835776a30b753905aab87aa75

commit_message:
Add update-trilio action

Add update-trilio action which can be run after a Trilio

Trilio sometimes updates packages in package repositiories that

updates are not applied by the charm as they would be by changing the

commit_message:
json_rpc: setup.cfg is missing entrypoint for json_rpc's list_opts

oslo.config is relying on the list_opts entrypoint to automatically
integrate the json_rpc options.

Story: 2009126
Task: 43038

Change-Id: Id50af71faec84bd778422ed86a3b99797158afdb

commit_message:
json_rpc: list_opts() should return tuple

list_opts() should return a tuple otherwise
oslo-config-(genera|valida)tors are unable to parse its output.

Story: 2009126
Task: 43039

commit_message:
BnR: managed ceph properly to take a backup of the node

This patch stops ceph services before doing a backup and
starts the ceph services after the backup. No matter how
ceph was installed (ceph-ansible or cephadm)

Change-Id: Iffab9c82f9ecdd5845cc93484ae15f70c9153341

commit_message:
Add missing elasticsearch cloudkitty storage
and prometheus collector backend support.

* Fix various remaining typos.
* Fix trailing character on reno.
* Enable Elasticsearch when selected as cloudkitty backend.
* Add a check for ES index creation when ES required.
* Add a release note
* Fix release note line length issue.

Change-Id: I18f3d8f2e10a2996b2ebf92733a1770bef548bda
Closes-bug: #1895945

commit_message:
osci, zuul, gitreview and Pin charmcraft to 0.10.2

Add osci config, zuul config, git review and pin charmcraft.
Charmcraft pin is to maintain support for building out of a
venv.

Change-Id: I0d11ce7dc7e7640c963d3807fcd91b64541c167d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-18 20:03:28.000000000', 'message': 'Specify certificates relation to update endpoints.

When the certificates relation is unspecified with the
configure_tls method invocation, the masakari endpoints
seem to ignore the update to TLS. This change specifies
the relation which causes the endpoints to update correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1935986
Change-Id: Ib1a6ca1ddf64950ff13cf3a8904d9848710d96a5
'}]
commit_message:
Specify certificates relation to update endpoints.

When the certificates relation is unspecified with the
configure_tls method invocation, the masakari endpoints
seem to ignore the update to TLS. This change specifies
the relation which causes the endpoints to update correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1935986
Change-Id: Ib1a6ca1ddf64950ff13cf3a8904d9848710d96a5

commit_message:
Compute HA: Remove version discovery of keystone API

Keystone removed its v2 API a long ago and now it provides v3 API only.
Thus we no longer need any logic depending on Keystone API version.

Change-Id: Ifffe5bea246478954f86e803f8038d73f039eaf8

subject: api: Remove various legacy extension prefixes
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-08-06 14:08:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-08-06 16:58:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

this is not mentioned in the spec - https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/xena/approved/configurable-instance-hostnames.html

Just to note, we tried to remove these legacy extension from API in train but we agreed not to do those as they are not much benefit of doing it than breaking users
 - Item# 3, L46 in https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/nova-api-cleanup

if we are touching the same API or field like 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:hostname instance' in this BP proposal then we can improve the field by removing the legacy prefix but for other unrelated API we should not. It will unnecessary ask users to change the things with not much gain."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-08-06 17:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded. For checking Nova with Ceph, add a comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Ceph Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/803756/1/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 10m 10s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-08-19 11:11:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-06 14:08:13.000000000', 'message': "api: Remove various legacy extension prefixes

Multiple APIs accept and return field with prefixes like
'OS-FLV-EXT-DATA'. These prefixes are a hangover from the days before
microversions, when nova's API supported extensions. They no longer make
much sense and can and should be dropped. Start doing this now. Given we
don't actually bump the max API microversion, much of what's added here
is effectively dead code and not easily testable via functional tests
but (a) we'll address that in future patches and (b) we have existing
tests to ensure we haven't broken the existing behavior.

While we're here, we move around some calls in the view code to get
things in the order of the microversion that added them.

Change-Id: I8775565081960cd6445e94011c5796250c87ed6b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Blueprint: configurable-instance-hostnames
"}]
commit_message:
api: Remove various legacy extension prefixes

Multiple APIs accept and return field with prefixes like
'OS-FLV-EXT-DATA'. These prefixes are a hangover from the days before
microversions, when nova's API supported extensions. They no longer make
much sense and can and should be dropped. Start doing this now. Given we
don't actually bump the max API microversion, much of what's added here
is effectively dead code and not easily testable via functional tests
but (a) we'll address that in future patches and (b) we have existing
tests to ensure we haven't broken the existing behavior.

While we're here, we move around some calls in the view code to get
things in the order of the microversion that added them.

Change-Id: I8775565081960cd6445e94011c5796250c87ed6b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Blueprint: configurable-instance-hostnames

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-16 11:26:26.000000000', 'message': "requirements: Bump sqlalchemy lower constraint

We've started using sqlalchemy features that were introduced in 1.4,
which means we need to bump our lower constraint. Do this now.

At some point, we probably want to dump all lower-constraint information
from these files since it's no longer maintainable without the
equivalent job. That's a task left to later, however.

Change-Id: I8629225eeb51d95264d8a3e4b719268bb1597f4f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
requirements: Bump sqlalchemy lower constraint

We've started using sqlalchemy features that were introduced in 1.4,
which means we need to bump our lower constraint. Do this now.

At some point, we probably want to dump all lower-constraint information
from these files since it's no longer maintainable without the
equivalent job. That's a task left to later, however.

Change-Id: I8629225eeb51d95264d8a3e4b719268bb1597f4f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

This builds upon a guide which was only included in the docs for
the rocky release.

This has been tested against two deployments running the victoria
release with ubuntu bionic, moving to ubuntu focal.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 20:59:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add config parameters to tune mnesia settings

When a RabbitMQ cluster is restarted, the mnesia settings determine
how long and how often each broker will try to connect to the cluster
before giving up. It might be useful for an operator to be able to
tune these parameters. This change adds two settings,
`mnesia-table-loading-retry-timeout` and
`mnesia-table-loading-retry-limit`, which set these parameters in the
rabbitmq.config file.

Change-Id: I96aa8c4061aed47eb2e844d1bec44fafd379ac25
Partial-Bug: #1828988
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add config parameters to tune mnesia settings

When a RabbitMQ cluster is restarted, the mnesia settings determine
how long and how often each broker will try to connect to the cluster
before giving up. It might be useful for an operator to be able to
tune these parameters. This change adds two settings,
`mnesia-table-loading-retry-timeout` and
`mnesia-table-loading-retry-limit`, which set these parameters in the
rabbitmq.config file [1].

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/configure.html#config-items

Change-Id: I96aa8c4061aed47eb2e844d1bec44fafd379ac25
Partial-Bug: #1828988
Related-Bug: #1874075
Co-authored-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Suppress policy deprecation and default change warnings

As part of the new policy work, all of the defaults for
policies were changed and warnings about it are being emitted
constantly in the logs. We can suppress these for now until we are
enforcing new defaults.

This also suppresses policy deprecation warnings during tests to avoid
filling the console with warning messages.

Change-Id: Ib2a7a2ed8bcadbb6a002cfa4b34c70910faa4f00

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 05:59:59.000000000', 'message': 'Cyborg backend port device support

I,e  SRIOV supported by Cyborg.

Steps to use Cyborg backend port device as SRIOV device:

1) create device profile:
   export GRP="[{\"resources:CUSTOM_NIC\":\"1\",\"trait:CUSTOM_GTPV1\":\"required\",
   \"trait:CUSTOM_PHYSNET1\":\"required\"}]"
   openstack accelerator device profile create SRIOV_NIC $GRP

2) create port with Cyborg backend device and set vnic type to
   direct:
   neutron port-create public --name test\
                     --port-backend=SRIOV_NIC --vnic-type=direct

3) boot instance with specified port with backend device:
   nova boot test --flavor <flavor name> --image <image name>\
               --nic port-id=<port-id>

Major code flow summary is the following:

1) On API stage, port backend device profile, "SRIOV_NIC" is used to
   create an ARQ by the interaction with Cyborg. And saved the ARQ uuid
   to request_net object.

2) While the instance's all request is fulfilled, i.e, after query
   Placement schedule to a host which could provides the device, Nova
   updates the ARQ binding info to Cyborg.

3) On host (n-cpu), while updating the neutron port binding info, device
   info is retrieved from Cyborg.

4) In the libvirt scope, with the correct binding info the specified PCI
   devices will appear in the instance via SRIOV passthrough.

Detailed information refers to spec.

Implements: blueprint sriov-smartnic-support

Change-Id: Idaf92c54df0f39d177d7acaabbfcf254ff5a4d0f
Signed-off-By: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shaohe Feng <shaohe.feng@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Xinran Wang <xin-ran.wang@intel.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-01-19 07:24:05.000000000', 'message': 'smartnic support

Steps to boot a Cyborg managed smartnic device:

1) create device profile:
2) create port with Cyborg backend device and set vnic type:
   neutron port-create public --name test\
                     --device-profile=SMART_NIC --vnic-type=accelorator-direct

3) boot instance with specified port with backend device:
   nova boot test --flavor <flavor name> --image <image name>\
               --nic port-id=<port-id>

Code flow summary:

1) On API stage, device profile "SMART_NIC" is used to create an ARQ.
   And saved the ARQ UUID to NetworkRequest.

2) After schedule instance come to a host, Nova updates the ARQ binding info
   to Cyborg.

3) Compute also updating the port binding info by the device info retrieved
   from Cyborg.

4) The virt drive passthrough the PCI devices to VM.

Implements: blueprint sriov-smartnic-support

Change-Id: Idaf92c54df0f39d177d7acaabbfcf254ff5a4d0f
Co-Authored-By: Shaohe Feng <shaohe.feng@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Xinran Wang <xin-ran.wang@intel.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-01-21 07:12:57.000000000', 'message': 'smartnic support

Steps to boot a Cyborg managed smartnic device:

1) create device profile:
2) create port with Cyborg backend device and set vnic type:
   neutron port-create public --name test\
                     --device-profile=SMART_NIC --vnic-type=accelorator-direct

3) boot instance with specified port with backend device:
   nova boot test --flavor <flavor name> --image <image name>\
               --nic port-id=<port-id>

Code flow summary:

1) On API stage, device profile "SMART_NIC" is used to create an ARQ.
   And saved the ARQ UUID to NetworkRequest.

2) After schedule instance come to a host, Nova updates the ARQ binding info
   to Cyborg.

3) Compute also updating the port binding info by the device info retrieved
   from Cyborg.

4) The virt drive passthrough the PCI devices to VM.

Implements: blueprint sriov-smartnic-support

Change-Id: Idaf92c54df0f39d177d7acaabbfcf254ff5a4d0f
Co-Authored-By: Shaohe Feng <shaohe.feng@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Xinran Wang <xin-ran.wang@intel.com>

   nova boot test --flavor <flavor name> --image <image name>\
               --nic port-id=<port-id>

Code flow summary:

1) On API stage, device profile "SMART_NIC" is used to get schedule profile.

2) After schedule instance come to a host, Conductor create ARQ and updates
   the ARQ binding info to Cyborg.

3) Compute also updating the port binding info by the device info retrieved
   from Cyborg.

4) The virt drive passthrough the PCI devices to VM.

Implements: blueprint sriov-smartnic-support

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/768324
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22bug%252F1906602%22+

commit_message:
smartnic support - create arqs

create arqs for port with device profile:

    - On API stage, device profile is used to get schedule infomations.

    - After schedule instance come to a host, Conductor create ARQ and updates
      the ARQ binding info to Cyborg.

Implements: blueprint sriov-smartnic-support

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/768324
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22bug%252F1906602%22+
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cyborg/+/758942

Change-Id: Idaf92c54df0f39d177d7acaabbfcf254ff5a4d0f
Co-Authored-By: Shaohe Feng <shaohe.feng@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Xinran Wang <xin-ran.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix get_deployment_status() for ephemeral heat

With ephemeral heat there would be no stack, so there is no point
checking for it.

Change-Id: I0162a0ab86689933f5935af6ee9e343bca6e8c54
(cherry picked from commit 0cde1bff4d101e9d5dc9657b1cf4f95bb89f6830)

commit_message:
Fetch stack after updating it

We update the stack assuming that there would be no change
during upgrades. This does not allow blacklisting nodes
during upgrades.

This probably won't be relevant for master/wallaby with
ephemeral heat. Only proposed for backport to older branches.

Change-Id: I3a154dbedd115d121bfc826513141c2d8be98508

commit_message:
Always use the distro-provided libvirt-python

This patch switches masakari-monitors image to follow nova-compute
and ceilometer-compute images.
This will be used and required after [1] merges.
Usage of libvirt-python from PyPI has already proven to be
problematic on CentOS Stream in our stable branches. [2]
With this patch we avoid those issues as well.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/masakari-monitors/+/804913
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/797102

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/masakari-monitors/+/804913
Change-Id: I7d4788f5b63fba24e3b2f9b15c16866ff811d83e

commit_message:
Add some system users to fix user uid inconsistencies

This patch is fixing user uids inconsistency between
base and openstack-base images.

Closes-Bug: #1934753
Change-Id: I614548b43de316d86bd53cec5e6b563204f9eff0

messages:

fixed; this one should be passing as the gate is not broken here'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-08-19 02:45:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2
> 
> fixed; this one should be passing as the gate is not broken here

To Radoslaw Piliszek:
When I run 'tox -e pdf-docs -vv', it failed with following output.
"""
The LaTeX files are in doc/build/pdf.
Run 'make' in that directory to run these through (pdf)latex
(use `make latexpdf' here to do that automatically).
pdf-docs run-test: commands[1] | make -C doc/build/pdf
setting PATH=/home/masakari-monitors/.tox/pdf-docs/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/root/bin
make: Entering directory `/home/masakari-monitors/doc/build/pdf'
latexmk -pdf -dvi- -ps-  'doc-masakari-monitors.tex'
[2041] /home/masakari-monitors$ /bin/make -C doc/build/pdf
make: latexmk: Command not found
make: *** [doc-masakari-monitors.pdf] Error 127
make: Leaving directory `/home/masakari-monitors/doc/build/pdf'
ERROR: InvocationError for command /bin/make -C doc/build/pdf (exited with code 2)
"""
Have you meet such problem? How to solve it?'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-08-19 02:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-19 06:32:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (use `make latexpdf' here to do that automatically).

> make: Entering directory `/home/masakari-monitors/doc/build/pdf'
> latexmk -pdf -dvi- -ps-  'doc-masakari-monitors.tex'

> """
> Have you meet such problem? How to solve it?

It works in the CI 😊 To generate pdf docs you have to install the latex tooling locally before trying to run this command. Try installing latexmk and texlive-xetex.'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-08-19 08:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

>

> > (use `make latexpdf' here to do that automatically).

> > ERROR: InvocationError for command /bin/make -C doc/build/pdf (exited with code 2)
> > """
> > Have you meet such problem? How to solve it?
> 
> It works in the CI 😊 To generate pdf docs you have to install the latex tooling locally before trying to run this command. Try installing latexmk and texlive-xetex.

It's not going well to install latex and  xelatex. But let's merge it.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-19 08:43:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1
> 
> > Patch Set 2:

> > > Patch Set 2:

> > > > 
> > > > fixed; this one should be passing as the gate is not broken here
> > > 
> > > To Radoslaw Piliszek:
> > > When I run 'tox -e pdf-docs -vv', it failed with following output.
> > > """
> > > The LaTeX files are in doc/build/pdf.
> > > Run 'make' in that directory to run these through (pdf)latex
> > > (use `make latexpdf' here to do that automatically).
> > > pdf-docs run-test: commands[1] | make -C doc/build/pdf
> > > setting PATH=/home/masakari-monitors/.tox/pdf-docs/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/root/bin
> > > make: Entering directory `/home/masakari-monitors/doc/build/pdf'
> > > latexmk -pdf -dvi- -ps-  'doc-masakari-monitors.tex'
> > > [2041] /home/masakari-monitors$ /bin/make -C doc/build/pdf
> > > make: latexmk: Command not found
> > > make: *** [doc-masakari-monitors.pdf] Error 127
> > > make: Leaving directory `/home/masakari-monitors/doc/build/pdf'
> > > ERROR: InvocationError for command /bin/make -C doc/build/pdf (exited with code 2)
> > > """
> > > Have you meet such problem? How to solve it?
> > 
> > It works in the CI 😊 To generate pdf docs you have to install the latex tooling locally before trying to run this command. Try installing latexmk and texlive-xetex.
> 
> It's not going well to install latex and  xelatex. But let's merge it.

Yeah, it's a different set of beasties there. I use LaTeX in my daily job as well so it's less of an issue for me. The pdf docs will be available for download from the docs pages. They are also included in the CI jobs results (you can download and read them there).

Thanks for approving. 😊

There is a companion change on the Masakari's main repo as well: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/masakari/+/686357'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-18 07:03:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add back collections_paths in ansible.cfg

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/801776
removed the collections_paths path from ansible.cfg which broke
ci.centos promotion job.

Since tripleo-operator-ansible is installed in venv in ci.centos
jobs and in order to discover that, we need the collections_path
pointing to venv in ansible.cfg.

Due to removal the job broke, adding it back to fix the issue.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id10132bdb6f999a3384359c6cbee3b144530ed48
'}]
commit_message:
Add back collections_paths in ansible.cfg

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/801776
removed the collections_paths path from ansible.cfg which broke
ci.centos promotion job.

Since tripleo-operator-ansible is installed in venv in ci.centos
jobs and in order to discover that, we need the collections_path
pointing to venv in ansible.cfg.

Due to removal the job broke, adding it back to fix the issue.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id10132bdb6f999a3384359c6cbee3b144530ed48

commit_message:
Remove libvirt-python from upper-constraints

... when installed from distribution.

This is mostly to fix Ironic's gate as their ecosystem is too
broad and complex to quickly remove libvirt-python from all
possible requirements.txt

More details inline.

See also: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/798514
aka f0bf2bdff12b66eefbb2eae83e919611eb7cc76d

Change-Id: Ic44daf15e952bbe3c424984ffb2474261e68008f

commit_message:
Generate Octavia ssh key from the octavia playbook

Unless it is explicitly set with the OctaviaAmphoraSshKeyFile parameter,
the Octavia ssh key is now automatically generated in the directory
pointed by the OctaviaAmphoraSshKeyDir parameter (default:
/etc/octavia/ssh)

Depends-On: I4f31ddc3392e70cff1187ba8b9511af12df4b063

Related-bug: #1907112
Change-Id: Idfc734022d40de82f510110ba7a5260a2118cb00

release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, August 23.

commit_message:
Release final blazar-nova for Xena

This proposed a release for blazar-nova to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, August 23.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.2.0..965f178
965f178 Switch to stestr
668323a Sync requirements and lower constraints with nova
5f7bd6e Add Python3 xena unit tests

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I720f4f2502765f459d24ec8a158a5fa038a65871

commit_message:
Update virtual media boot-related constants

Constants related to virtual media boot are modified to identify LC and
RAC event messages only, and not the version.

Story: 2008708
Task: 42042

commit_message:
Remove old oslo.messaging transport aliases

Those are remnants from the oslo-incubator times. Also, oslo.messaging
deprecated [1] transport aliases since 5.2.0+ that is the minimal
version supported for stable/newton.The patch that bumped the minimal
version for Tacker landed 3 months+ ago, so we can proceed ripping
those aliases from the code base

[1] I314cefa5fb1803fa7e21e3e34300e5ced31bba89

Change-Id: I53b3729ff23f1597e4b80e3c0652830d3243e320

commit_message:
Update RETRY_COUNT for virtual media boot

Increase RETRY_COUNT to 35 to provide sufficient time to complete
already running iDRAC configuration job. This has been observed when
ironic performs boot mode synchronization, because the node boot mode
is not the same as bare-metal boot mode.

Story: 2008709
Task: 42043

Change-Id: I78c503a65c0c3fdb17773279d87db425926fa275
(cherry picked from commit 56032c4d176b17a859328f1006ca537fc0d12f1e)

messages: [{'account_id': 32291, 'date': '2021-08-13 08:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2021-08-19 06:06:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-13 08:58:00.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec

inspect.getargspec was deprecated since Python 3.0 and
inspect.getfullargspec is its replacement with correct handling of
function annotations and keyword-only parameters[1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: I2411be23a83aef9550d58ead51b4caf2f8c5409f
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec

inspect.getargspec was deprecated since Python 3.0 and
inspect.getfullargspec is its replacement with correct handling of
function annotations and keyword-only parameters[1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: I2411be23a83aef9550d58ead51b4caf2f8c5409f

subject: Move tripleo repos to independent release model
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18002, 'name': 'John Fulton', 'email': 'fulton@redhat.com', 'username': 'fultonj'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-08-17 12:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-08-17 12:30:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1 Workflow-1

+1 for PTL may be needed but workflow -1 until we are ready when the spec merges'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-08-17 14:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow

the spec has been worfklowed'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2021-08-17 14:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-08-17 14:37:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-08-17 14:56:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Hello,

All your repos seems migrated:

```
$ tox -e venv -- list-deliverables --series xena --team tripleo
...
venv run-test-pre: PYTHONHASHSEED='3794253545'
venv run-test: commands[0] | list-deliverables --series xena --team tripleo
_______________________________________________________ summary _______________________________________________________
  venv: commands succeeded
  congratulations :)
```

I think it's not too late to migrate these deliverables. We are close to the feature freeze and close to the milestone 3 but I think it is still ok to migrate them. However, before pushing the merging button I will discuss a bit about this with my team first. I only +1ed for now."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-08-17 15:33:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Strictly from release yamls perspective, I have two comments/questions: I am unsure about puppet-tripleo and tripleo-ansible's release type change.

On the other hand, as I read through the linked mail thread and thinking on this change, I have multiple feelings. Anyway, clearly, I don't really have enough release manager experience to judge this change. I don't see what consequences it will have, what issues we may face. Though it could work I guess."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-08-17 15:54:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

thanks for comments Herve and Elod appreciate your thoughts as always

fyi so you don't think i am ignoring you I will be out over the next few days but weshay will be watching here and can update if something is needed"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-08-17 16:00:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-08-17 16:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2021-08-17 17:33:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> Strictly from release yamls perspective, I have two comments/questions: I am unsure about puppet-tripleo and tripleo-ansible's release type change.
> 
> On the other hand, as I read through the linked mail thread and thinking on this change, I have multiple feelings. Anyway, clearly, I don't really have enough release manager experience to judge this change. I don't see what consequences it will have, what issues we may face. Though it could work I guess.

looks like we do have artifacts in pypi. sorry I didn't realize that."}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2021-08-17 17:33:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2021-08-17 17:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

To be clear.. as a project the only install method that is community supported is via rpm.
The pypi artifacts look like something that is just for openstack compliance.  Nothing *needs* to be in pypi to enable the community.

https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-docs/latest/
https://www.rdoproject.org/'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-08-18 10:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This looks good to me, my only question would be around the need to release tripleo-ansible on Pypi. It's never been released there, so I'm not sure we should start now? It would only be required for "OpenStack compliance" if we consumed those in our requirements, and that is not the case.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-08-18 10:06:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-08-18 13:18:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-08-18 13:19:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-08-18 13:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-08-18 14:59:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2021-08-18 18:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-08-19 06:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Move tripleo repos to independent release model

folder and removes the xena one.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-specs/+/801512

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/788990
Change-Id: I78f33c2f31e4db3927326ccb3289eecdc5beea0d

Set "disabled reason" for compute service.

Masakari never sets reason why compute service was disabled.
"disabled reason" was added in config.

Closes-Bug: 1936181

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-27 23:01:40.000000000', 'message': "Replace tests for API version 1.0 with 2.0

Manila does not support an API micro version called '1.0';
micro versions are a function of the v2 API, and they begin
with micro version 2.0.

However, in some tests, we use the notation '1.0' to indicate
the deprecated v1 API; this notation is problematic with the way
the tests are judged for skipping based on versions supported.

The skip check method [1] checks whether the version being requested
is supported per min and max versions in the config file. By default,
the min version is set to 2.0 [2]. So these tests are ALWAYS
being skipped, e.g.:

manila_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_security_services.SecurityServicesTest.test_list_security_services_with_detail_1_1_0 ... SKIPPED: Skipped. Test requires microversion '1.0'.

So wherever we use this skip-if-unsupported-api-version logic, we can
replace '1.0' with '2.0' since we know functionally API micro version
2.0 behaves exactly like the v1 API.

This commit doesn't eliminate all instances of '1.0' in the tests; we
could consider doing that in a subsequent change; for now preserving
the other tests as is will give us the advantage of still testing the
deprecated v1 API paths.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/src/commit/a0acf25969daf37f3b1f527809f297e6ba227cc9/manila_tempest_tests/utils.py#L98-L102
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/src/commit/b60fddac7f00824028e7f93678d3daaa62ea9adf/manila_tempest_tests/config.py#L27-L32

Change-Id: I0fc9885ef6ef954bbd40477db8d6f05477324581
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Replace tests for API version 1.0 with 2.0

Manila does not support an API micro version called '1.0';
micro versions are a function of the v2 API, and they begin
with micro version 2.0.

However, in some tests, we use the notation '1.0' to indicate
the deprecated v1 API; this notation is problematic with the way
the tests are judged for skipping based on versions supported.

The skip check method [1] checks whether the version being requested
is supported per min and max versions in the config file. By default,
the min version is set to 2.0 [2]. So these tests are ALWAYS
being skipped, e.g.:

manila_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_security_services.SecurityServicesTest.test_list_security_services_with_detail_1_1_0 ... SKIPPED: Skipped. Test requires microversion '1.0'.

So wherever we use this skip-if-unsupported-api-version logic, we can
replace '1.0' with '2.0' since we know functionally API micro version
2.0 behaves exactly like the v1 API.

This commit doesn't eliminate all instances of '1.0' in the tests; we
could consider doing that in a subsequent change; for now preserving
the other tests as is will give us the advantage of still testing the
deprecated v1 API paths.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/src/commit/a0acf25969daf37f3b1f527809f297e6ba227cc9/manila_tempest_tests/utils.py#L98-L102
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/src/commit/b60fddac7f00824028e7f93678d3daaa62ea9adf/manila_tempest_tests/config.py#L27-L32

Change-Id: I0fc9885ef6ef954bbd40477db8d6f05477324581
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Workaround py36 encoding pip bug

* ensures we add LC_ALL with UTF8 if not already set
* consolidate tox.ini indentation
* expose only generic py env on envlist
* sort envvars in tox

Change-Id: I3d01c5a19500db9a830c78193f82175b4c1d4361
Related: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/804890/

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-27 10:23:29.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Abort live-migration job when monitoring fails

During live migration process, a _live_migration_monitor thread
check progress of migration on source host, if for any reason
we hit infrastructure issue involving a DB/RPC/libvirt-timeout
failure, Exception raises to manager and instance/migration
is set to ERROR state.

The issue is that we may let live-migration job running out of nova
control. At the end of job, guest is resumed on target host while
nova still reports it on source host, this may lead to a split-brain
situation if instance is restarted.

This change proposes to abort live-migration job if issue occurs
during _live_migration_monitor.

Change-Id: Ia593b500425c81e54eb401e38264db5cc5fc1f93
Closes-Bug: #1905944

commit_message:
libvirt: Abort live-migration job when monitoring fails

During live migration process, a _live_migration_monitor thread
checks progress of migration on source host, if for any reason
we hit infrastructure issue involving a DB/RPC/libvirt-timeout
failure, an Exception is raised to the nova-compute service and
instance/migration is set to ERROR state.

The issue is that we may let live-migration job running out of nova
control. At the end of job, guest is resumed on target host while
nova still reports it on source host, this may lead to a split-brain
situation if instance is restarted.

This change proposes to abort live-migration job if issue occurs
during _live_migration_monitor.

Change-Id: Ia593b500425c81e54eb401e38264db5cc5fc1f93
Closes-Bug: #1905944

commit_message:
Bump Ceph container daemons to v6.0.4

The stable Ceph containers v16.2.5 are now released.
This change aligns the new tag with the latest released stable
content (which is v6.0.4 for the daemon images).

Change-Id: I50a683aaa7062f7f33d6de45758844c8523da7f2
(cherry picked from commit 13614295b286fd5d5a2e2cde22455c743710391e)

commit_message:
Replace overcloud-delete.sh script with tripleo operator roles

This patch will remove all shell scripts and replace
them with tripleo operator ansible roles.

Change-Id: I1532f87a374631692a732999d3c3ed02fbcb9fef
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

and 'accelerator-direct-physical'.

Cyborg ARQ UUID is saved in NetworkRequest.

commit_message:
smartnic support - new vnic type

There are 2 vnic type added to support smatnic: 'accelerator-direct'
and 'accelerator-direct-physical'.

arq uuid and port device profile keep in NetworkRequest.

Change-Id: I6c9c6d26edfcd4419371282222d128beedf7fa70
Implements: blueprint sriov-smartnic-support

commit_message:
Use pre-provided libvirt-python

This is to satisfy both libvirtd compatibility and recent pip
sanity checks that started failing in DevStack jobs after [1],
impacting the main Masakari gate.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/802642

Change-Id: I448b9d2535bfaffa5a3bb77307baa0527a005144

commit_message:
Gather config files for libvirt

This change ensures that config files for the libvirt service is
gathered when copying log files so that we can debug any issue with
the libvirt service in detail.

Change-Id: I05bda8921a97e2c3dad2ffcb3784cd43b7f6654b
(cherry picked from commit d1e9389e3fdd5b5fcee94901ae34c3533571266e)

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: Ifb8d4f589c2fb8fa2adc0372d1d54077afe5b32d

commit_message:
Replace deprecated import of ABCs from collections

ABCs in collections should be imported from collections.abc and direct
import from collections is deprecated since Python 3.3.

Closes-Bug: #1936667
Change-Id: I60679f9e78e91bce1145d899332e871dd62d3a9c

commit_message:
Fix dstat options

--top-io-adv and --top-cpu-adv aren't options in c8, so let's make their
usage dynamic

Change-Id: I1fc97d77311763d972b2da925f87d09caa9b21ee

messages: [{'account_id': 32291, 'date': '2021-08-13 08:46:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-08-18 13:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2\n\nsame as https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/800918'}, {'account_id': 32291, 'date': '2021-08-19 01:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-13 08:46:22.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec

inspect.getargspec was deprecated since Python 3.0 and
inspect.getfullargspec is its replacement with correct handling of
function annotations and keyword-only parameters[1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: Ieb44681df75e763d7d8ac51972f47141f649f213
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec

inspect.getargspec was deprecated since Python 3.0 and
inspect.getfullargspec is its replacement with correct handling of
function annotations and keyword-only parameters[1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: Ieb44681df75e763d7d8ac51972f47141f649f213

use payloads for FLOATING_IP

This patch switches over to callback payloads for
FLOATING_IP PRECOMMIT_CREATE and PRECOMMIT_UPDATE events

Change-Id: I886a360b838c78b0596c042fb5650bc73848af31

messages:

-1 for visibility, random suggestion inline.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-06-07 10:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2021-06-07 15:07:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

The CI failure is legit, but assuming that'll get fixed I'm +1 on this. I *still* think volumeAttachment having both an 'id' and an 'attachmentId' field to mean different things is super confusing, but I can't come up with a palatable solution, so I guess really explicit documentation will have to do."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-06-07 15:39:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
> 
> The CI failure is legit, but assuming that'll get fixed I'm +1 on this. I *still* think volumeAttachment having both an 'id' and an 'attachmentId' field to mean different things is super confusing, but I can't come up with a palatable solution, so I guess really explicit documentation will have to do.

Thanks, weird about the error, fast-specs works but I guess docs is doing some additional validation of the JSON blobs? Anyway I'll take a look now."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-06-07 15:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2021-06-07 16:34:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

See previous note about volumeAttachment['id'] and volumeAttachment['attachmentId'] - but I don't have a better idea (that Lee can live with). Maybe someone else will come up with one :)"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-06-09 07:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The proposal looks good to me. After you filed a bp and referenced in the spec I will +2 it.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-06-09 09:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-06-09 09:49:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-06-09 10:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

As promised :)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2021-06-18 13:38:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Still sad about the volumeAttachment['id'] and volumeAttachment['attachmentId'] confusion, and would ideally like for someone to come up with a less confusing API that's not a ton of work, but since so far no one (including me) has got anything, I'm +1."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-07-01 10:19:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

sorry this took so long.
this makes a lot of sense to expose to me and i dont see any open question so +2+w from me'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-07-01 10:24:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1
> 
> Still sad about the volumeAttachment['id'] and volumeAttachment['attachmentId'] confusion, and would ideally like for someone to come up with a less confusing API that's not a ton of work, but since so far no one (including me) has got anything, I'm +1.

we coudl call it volumeAttachment['index'] or volumeAttachment['internal_id'] instead of volumeAttachment['id'] but that feels like an api breakage for little benifit to me.

if pepople think volumeAttachment['id'] to volumeAttachment['internal_id'] is a good idea i would be happy to do that in a follow up and include both changes in the same microversion to avoid the confusion that can be caused.

volumeAttachment['id'] is just the pirmary key in the nova db i belive which normally is not exposed when we have a seperate uuid column but since this is kind of an internal data stucture i get ehy we exposed it in this case"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-08-18 23:48:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Add attachmentId to responses of the os-volume_attachments API

A simple spec adding the id of Cinder volume attachments associated with
a given block device mapping record within Nova to the responses from
the os-volume_attachments API.

Change-Id: Ifb3a14607faaebd2e63468e332089e4f1881e0a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-05 13:53:32.000000000', 'message': 'Block servers wit vGPU and device profile in heal_allocations

Nested allocations are only partially supported in nova-manage placement
heal_allocations CLI. This patch documents the missing support and
blocks healing instances with VGPU or Cyborg device profile request in
the embedded flavor. Blocking is needed as if --forced is used with such
instances then the tool could recreate an allocation ignoring some of
these resources.

Change-Id: I89ac90d2ea8bc268940869dbbc90352bfad5c0de
Related-Bug: bug/1939020
'}, {'created': '2021-08-06 14:00:22.000000000', 'message': 'Block servers with vGPU and device profile in heal_allocations

Nested allocations are only partially supported in nova-manage placement
heal_allocations CLI. This patch documents the missing support and
blocks healing instances with VGPU or Cyborg device profile request in
the embedded flavor. Blocking is needed as if --forced is used with such
instances then the tool could recreate an allocation ignoring some of
these resources.

Change-Id: I89ac90d2ea8bc268940869dbbc90352bfad5c0de
Related-Bug: bug/1939020
'}]
commit_message:
Block servers with vGPU and device profile in heal_allocations

Nested allocations are only partially supported in nova-manage placement
heal_allocations CLI. This patch documents the missing support and
blocks healing instances with VGPU or Cyborg device profile request in
the embedded flavor. Blocking is needed as if --forced is used with such
instances then the tool could recreate an allocation ignoring some of
these resources.

Change-Id: I89ac90d2ea8bc268940869dbbc90352bfad5c0de
Related-Bug: bug/1939020

subject: Add cinder v3 availability_zone_client

- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-trusty-mitaka http://logs.openstack.org/56/405156/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-trusty-mitaka/9e7f49c/ : SUCCESS in 43m 39s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-trusty-liberty http://logs.openstack.org/56/405156/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-trusty-liberty/e808791/ : SUCCESS in 30m 02s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-trusty-liberty http://logs.openstack.org/56/405156/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-trusty-liberty/9841c5e/ : SUCCESS in 35m 17s'}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2016-12-02 12:14:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Do you have a test that specifically needs that client ? How is cinder V3 different that V2 when it comes to availabity_zone ?

I suggest we introduce that client when we really needs it.'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-12-02 12:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Its a issue of decision , if you want to see the tests that related , i can add them .

From my view of point , i can add the clients first with unit tests , and in the next cycle to add all API tests and make order .

What do you suggest ?'}, {'account_id': 22696, 'date': '2016-12-05 08:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7020, 'date': '2016-12-07 11:25:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

LGTM.

I think it should be fine adding the clients without the tests, since we're exposing them to the plugin interface for the world to use."}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2016-12-07 13:17:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I do agree with Jordan, I'd like to see the feature along with some test that make use of it. From my point of view otherwise we risk just having around dead code. Could you please put up some test making use of the client alongside with this patch? Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-12-07 13:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Daniel , 
Please read the comment i got from Andrea Frittoli:
In patch - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404056/

Andrea Frittoli
Nov 30 5:20 PM
↩
Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1
Thank you for your effort on this very large patch.
I haven't really reviewed this, but I fear this will have to be split into multiple parts.
Add a new client to tempest lib, along with unit tests and release notes should go in a dedicated set of patches. Give the size of each client modules I think it would be better to have multiple patches
Run existing tests for volume v3, plus v3 specific tests - several patches. This would add about 150 tests to the gate; I would prefer to see tests introduced at a slower rate, to avoid gate instability."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2016-12-07 18:48:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I have heard

 Cinder v3 API = Cinder v2 API + microversions

So the base microversion of v3 API should be completely the same as v2 API.
As Jordan's comment, I think we don't need to implement the existing v2 API clients for v3 API. Actually, this az client seems copy&paste from v2 API, that doesn't seem good for long-term maintenance."}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-12-07 19:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Kenichi,
What do you suggest for cinder v3 ? How can we run it ? basically its the same as v2 as far as i know.
Can you explain how to test cinder v3 ?
Sooner cinder v1 is going to be depreceted ... 
Thanks, 
Benny'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2016-12-07 19:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yeah, a nice point. Benny

This could be the same as Nova v2.1 API.
Nova also is like

 Nova v2.1 API = Nova v2.0 API + microversions

and we are using the same Tempest test code for both Nova APIs by switching the endpoint between v2.0 and v2.1 like

 devstack: https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/tempest#L317
 project-config: https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml#L409

So I guess we can do that for Cinder APIs also.'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-12-08 04:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Kenichi, 
In case cinder v3 code is going to change or a new command (API) will be added , how can we manage it ?
Currenly today we have a code duplication and addon per version in :
/lib/services/identity/v2/users_client.py and /v3/users_client.py
and same fro /lib/services/volume/v1 and v2 and now will be v3.
and /lib/services/glance/v1 and v2  .
IMO its better to implement all clients at the same way , keep the same structure for all tempest services especially when its going to be shared to others.

I know its duplication of code but it will allow us in the feature and special API command or handle exceptions /issues per client version .

Please let me know how to procceed from here ? 

I appriciate your support and its my pleasure to learn from you.

Thanks,
Benny'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-12-08 04:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Maybe we can implement it like this :
https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/master/cinderclient/v2/volume_backups_restore.py

Just import the from  and not a full code duplication(copy paste).

What do you think ?'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2016-12-08 07:49:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm not qualified for this review, but I think that Ken'ichi is right. If the cinder v3 is just v2+microversioning, then it should be implemented like the nova client. It would be a different case than the other clients (volume/image/identity) where the API is totally different. Can you check this?"}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-12-08 08:22:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Luigi, 
In case we share tempest /lib/services/volume/  
Assume other project is trying to use shared lib (import) , how can he choose v3 version for volume requests?  
Are we expecting that cinder v2 will be forever active and supported ?



Benny'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2016-12-08 08:36:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

To answer your question, you need to check if it is true that cinder v3 is really the same as cinder v2 + microversion.'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-12-08 08:41:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Probably it is , 
Cinder v3 API = Cinder v2 API + microversions'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-12-11 08:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-12-11 09:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Add cinder v3 availability_zone_client

Create a library for availability_zone_client
Add a unit-test for availability_zone_client

commit_message:
Doc: IBM Storages user documentation update

Minor update to Spectrum Virtualize Family user documentation.
Updated new IBM storage names in support matrix.
Also marks the following capabilities as 'complete' for the Storwize driver:
-thin provisioning
-storage assisted volume migration

Change-Id: Icb78771a8466cec25a0aab358c1e1ed3195db925

Horizon's stable/pike transitioned to End of Life and its stable/pike
branch was deleted. This fix uses the pike-eol tag to be able to check

"}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Use pike-eol for horizon

Horizon's stable/pike transitioned to End of Life and its stable/pike
branch was deleted. This fix uses the pike-eol tag to be able to check
out horizon's latest state from pike.

Change-Id: I4b78aceff43c78c80ce32f84d332b576b420c91c

subject: Use py3 as the default runtime for tox
messages:
[{'account_id': 31412, 'date': '2021-04-20 02:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2021-05-04 17:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-05-05 07:47:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Looking at the feedback from the same patch to other projects, there isn't a clear agreement that this is the right thing to do.

For example see https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/placement/+/786998"}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-08-18 21:14:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Even though I don't think this is the right approach, it doesn't impact the code itself. Let's merge so it clears the review queue."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-20 02:41:06.000000000', 'message': "Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ifa518bcfbb42030faa847d7d808d25c51ec3b69c
"}]
commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ifa518bcfbb42030faa847d7d808d25c51ec3b69c

subject: Use py3 as the default runtime for tox
messages:
[{'account_id': 31412, 'date': '2021-04-20 02:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2021-05-04 16:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1 Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2021-05-04 17:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-05-05 07:48:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Looking at the feedback from the same patch to other projects, there isn't a clear agreement that this is the right thing to do.

For example see https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/placement/+/786998"}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2021-05-05 10:40:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> Looking at the feedback from the same patch to other projects, there isn't a clear agreement that this is the right thing to do.
> 
> For example see https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/placement/+/786998

I do not see the problem on using python3 (whatever middle version it is). As far as I understood, the goal for this patch is to define python 3 as the default without defining a middle version, that can change depending on the operating system. If the user/CI wants/needs, they can still do tox -epy37, -epy38, and so on to validate the other python3 versions."}, {'account_id': 25277, 'date': '2021-05-07 12:43:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > Looking at the feedback from the same patch to other projects, there isn't a clear agreement that this is the right thing to do.
> > 
> > For example see https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/placement/+/786998
> 
> I do not see the problem on using python3 (whatever middle version it is). As far as I understood, the goal for this patch is to define python 3 as the default without defining a middle version, that can change depending on the operating system. If the user/CI wants/needs, they can still do tox -epy37, -epy38, and so on to validate the other python3 versions.

True, but remember that Python 3 is in active development and there is no way for us to tell which features will be removed in future releases."}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-08-18 21:14:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Even though I don't think this is the right approach, it doesn't impact the code itself. Let's merge so it clears the review queue."}]

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Id917b883da6010f028a40be7acbe4e3a772f9408

subject: ring: Allow 32-bit (or even 8-bit) device IDs
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-11-06 21:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-11-06 21:19:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

Needs more tests (in particular for round-tripping rings to disk and back) and probably could use a proper bug written up, but at least it's a start!"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2020-11-06 22:58:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Nice, and I like this means someone is reaching the end of the 2 byte device size :)

I'll look forward to playing with this. I would be nice if you could just add more devices and ringbuilder would automatically adjust."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-11-06 23:23:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Nice, and I like this means someone is reaching the end of the 2 byte device size :)

IIRC, Romain was already starting to bump up against this limit -- we're not there *just* yet (so no big sense of urgency) but it's definitely going to become a issue within the next couple years or so.

> It would be nice if you could just add more devices and ringbuilder would automatically adjust.

Yeah, I thought about that -- I don't think it'd be *too* hard to do, but I think we'd probably want a cycle or two with it manually managed first (since old code will behave badly if it gets non-16-bit rings)."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2020-11-07 03:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

yeah, I wonder if this is one of those changes we need to increment change the ring version number/magic string, so old servers opening a new ring will error and fail to open them rather then opening them with interesting side effects?'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-11-10 00:50:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

This looks very suspicious, although my understanding of our ring is on the superficial side.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-11-10 00:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-11-10 16:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-25 16:15:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-06-29 17:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2021-08-18 21:37:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

(1 comment)

this is a great idea!   let's add more explicit support for floating length part2dev_id reads and also make sure we can add "extend" v2 rings with an extra variable length last_primary table hanging off the end past the replica table!'}]

commit_message:
Migrate from testr to stestr

* Replace .testr.conf by .stestr.conf for migration and update
  .gitignore, test-requirements.txt and lower-constraints.txt
  files accordingly
* Use py3 as the default runtime for tox and 3.18.0 as the
  minversion for tox
* Add a new job, openstack-cover-jobs, to run the coverage in Zuul

Change-Id: If6fa3f2f861d5eb6787743edcc6333e5aacef7d0

commit_message:
Reword release note to use style of other notes

This patch also updates the link to keystoneauth1 to use opendev.org and
point to a specific tag (I picked 3.4.0 which is our lower constraint),
so the link remains valid even if http.py is renamed or deleted in
future versions.

Change-Id: Ifd2d0ef580c4f7bd04b03a9fe37c5b0efd4352c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-18 08:53:05.000000000', 'message': 'Remove now useless sudo call for port check

Back then, the "sudo" was needed because healthchecks were running as
root, using a paunch created systemd unit/timer calling "podman exec
--user root".

Now that we're using native healthchecks, we can get rid of the sudo
call, since it's already using as the intended user.

Closes-Bug: #1940068

Change-Id: I7eaabc91005952aa956456944c46224f08f4c7f8
(cherry picked from commit 36a7a4d093470ffe5d970cc288da292714b48f2a)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove now useless sudo call for port check

Back then, the "sudo" was needed because healthchecks were running as
root, using a paunch created systemd unit/timer calling "podman exec
--user root".

Now that we're using native healthchecks, we can get rid of the sudo
call, since it's already using as the intended user.

Closes-Bug: #1940068

Change-Id: I7eaabc91005952aa956456944c46224f08f4c7f8
(cherry picked from commit 36a7a4d093470ffe5d970cc288da292714b48f2a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-10 19:43:00.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor methods in cinder store

Some of the methods in cinder store are only used by the Store class
methods and not used outside.
It makes sense to bound them to the class.
This refactoring will also help in handling the None imports inside
the class configure methods which will be done in a followup.

This patch also updates cinderclient version from v2(deprecated) to
v3(current).

Change-Id: I576b787012e73ebaf3274cfd8c31f79894284891
(cherry picked from commit 4da861ae07106504f89a084ad190e8276847eb3a)
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor methods in cinder store

Some of the methods in cinder store are only used by the Store class
methods and not used outside.
It makes sense to bound them to the class.
This refactoring will also help in handling the None imports inside
the class configure methods which will be done in a followup.

This patch also updates cinderclient version from v2(deprecated) to
v3(current).

Change-Id: I576b787012e73ebaf3274cfd8c31f79894284891
(cherry picked from commit 4da861ae07106504f89a084ad190e8276847eb3a)

commit_message:
Revert change to use community pacemaker_cluster module

The community pacemaker_cluster module is not in sync
with the real pacemaker_cluster module causing failures.

https://github.com/ansible-collections/community.general/blob/main/plugins/modules/clustering/pacemaker_cluster.py#L19-L39
vs
https://github.com/redhat-openstack/ansible-pacemaker/blob/master/modules/pacemaker_cluster.py#L32-L58

This causes failures in the minor update process.

Related: Ie96b3d35cea61370b1f98d7e060d696c4807c6b7
Closes-Bug: #1938967
Change-Id: Id65f0eef7249588d6038883f703d8e587826a4ac
(cherry picked from commit b0caee4753efd5f5d0f769d73bb8826dc8466de2)

messages:
[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-06-24 10:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30742, 'date': '2021-06-29 08:46:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM!'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2021-08-12 11:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-08-18 17:42:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

scenario tests do not reply on run_validation option (which create the validation resources and then test does ssh with those validation). only API tests reply on validation resources and so does are skipped if test need to ssh into server.

As most of the scenario test need ssh, we recommend to just skip it via regex if no ssh enabled in the env.

There was discussion in wallaby qa PTG to move scenario tests to centralized validation resources or so but no progress on that.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-08-18 18:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
test_network_basic_ops: Add skip if run_validations is False

Required as test_network_basic_ops will attempt to ssh into the instance
to assert various things and would previously ignore the value of
run_validations.

Change-Id: I585c34aeefb46f2fe08c64b6240b1b8ccde6017f

When doing A/A we need the etcd certs in the cinder_api container
otherwise we fail with:
[Mon Aug 16 15:28:58.945345 2021] [wsgi:error] [pid 12] [remote 172.30.1.1:48082] File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 416, in send
[Mon Aug 16 15:28:58.945347 2021] [wsgi:error] [pid 12] [remote 172.30.1.1:48082] self.cert_verify(conn, request.url, verify, cert)
[Mon Aug 16 15:28:58.945351 2021] [wsgi:error] [pid 12] [remote 172.30.1.1:48082] File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 250, in cert_verify
[Mon Aug 16 15:28:58.945354 2021] [wsgi:error] [pid 12] [remote 172.30.1.1:48082] "invalid path: {}".format(conn.cert_file))
[Mon Aug 16 15:28:58.945370 2021] [wsgi:error] [pid 12] [remote 172.30.1.1:48082] OSError: Could not find the TLS certificate file, invalid path: /etc/pki/tls/certs/etcd.crt

After this change I correctly see the certs in the containers:
[root@ctrl-1-0 ~]# podman exec -it cinder_api sh -c 'ls -lR /etc/pki/tls' |grep etcd
-rw-------. 1 cinder cinder 1907 Aug 16 19:47 etcd.crt
-rw-------. 1 cinder cinder 1708 Aug 16 19:47 etcd.key

And am able to create a cinder A/A volume.

We remove the following two bind mounts:
- /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/cinder:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src:ro
- /var/log/containers/cinder:/var/log/cinder:z

Because they are contained in cinder_common_volumes, which will also
bind mount the etcd certs appropriately when needed. Since
cinder_common_volumes also containerd ContainersCommon -> volumes
we are not removing any bind mount.

Likely removed by accident via I0e3d5748a50937880a55413b75fe6eca479c9160

Closes-Bug: #1940306

Change-Id: Ife89262675eefb645e61e6d029b4846f1a33a677
'}]
commit_message:
cinder_api needs etcd certs inside the container

When doing A/A we need the etcd certs in the cinder_api container
otherwise we fail with:
[Mon Aug 16 15:28:58.945345 2021] [wsgi:error] [pid 12] [remote 172.30.1.1:48082] File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 416, in send
[Mon Aug 16 15:28:58.945347 2021] [wsgi:error] [pid 12] [remote 172.30.1.1:48082] self.cert_verify(conn, request.url, verify, cert)
[Mon Aug 16 15:28:58.945351 2021] [wsgi:error] [pid 12] [remote 172.30.1.1:48082] File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 250, in cert_verify
[Mon Aug 16 15:28:58.945354 2021] [wsgi:error] [pid 12] [remote 172.30.1.1:48082] "invalid path: {}".format(conn.cert_file))
[Mon Aug 16 15:28:58.945370 2021] [wsgi:error] [pid 12] [remote 172.30.1.1:48082] OSError: Could not find the TLS certificate file, invalid path: /etc/pki/tls/certs/etcd.crt

After this change I correctly see the certs in the containers:
[root@ctrl-1-0 ~]# podman exec -it cinder_api sh -c 'ls -lR /etc/pki/tls' |grep etcd
-rw-------. 1 cinder cinder 1907 Aug 16 19:47 etcd.crt
-rw-------. 1 cinder cinder 1708 Aug 16 19:47 etcd.key

And am able to create a cinder A/A volume.

We remove the following two bind mounts:
- /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/cinder:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src:ro
- /var/log/containers/cinder:/var/log/cinder:z

Because they are contained in cinder_common_volumes, which will also
bind mount the etcd certs appropriately when needed. Since
cinder_common_volumes also containerd ContainersCommon -> volumes
we are not removing any bind mount.

Likely removed by accident via I0e3d5748a50937880a55413b75fe6eca479c9160

Closes-Bug: #1940306

Change-Id: Ife89262675eefb645e61e6d029b4846f1a33a677

commit_message:
Add  tripleo-undercloud job

TripleO uses ironic + networking-baremetal in undercloud while it does
not use ironic in overcloud. This change adds tripleo-undercloud so
that code specific to networking-baremetal is tested.

Change-Id: Ie8e668e4660228d0aa9798f894ffa6a7826850ea
(cherry picked from commit ccf6b4912ebe48d11d3b8d3cb1162a29fae1e026)

commit_message:
Don't configure databases to replicate w/out async

Check that that the asynchronous replication relations exist prior
to providing the databases_to_replicate to the templating engine
code. Specifying the databases-to-replicate config option is not
supposed to apply when the asynchronous relation is not established.

Closes-Bug: #1934680
Change-Id: Iedd0532268f0bf533305412105590c5afdd7c0ec

commit_message:
Fix race conditions between API and worker DB calls

The Octavia API creates new resource in the DB and passes the resource
and its ID to the worker. The worker then accesses to the resource using
the database, but it might try to fetch the element before it's
commited by the API.
This commit ensures that the resource has been commited to the DB before
processing the request.

Story 2008878
Task 42423

Change-Id: I55136f570db33cfd22e919019c18e9028a6a9bf7
(cherry picked from commit cd272ae5a948c22e26b0ea678ea452f559e14d62)
(cherry picked from commit bd01b2b0b86444bc1fa4501d90c7285ec3368c21)
(cherry picked from commit 732e0ad6cbeb1b8bc41110e67caf5c7c10cdf956)

Fix race conditions between API and worker DB calls

The Octavia API creates new resource in the DB and passes the resource
and its ID to the worker. The worker then accesses to the resource using
the database, but it might try to fetch the element before it's
commited by the API.
This commit ensures that the resource has been commited to the DB before
processing the request.

Task 42423
